Description: AWARD PURPOSE: OWYHEE STATE PARK NEEDS TO REPLACE THE EXISTING FISH GRINDER AND CLEANING STATION WITH A HIGHER CAPACITY GRINDER THAT CAN HANDLE A HIGHER VOLUME OF FISH. THE CURRENT FACILITY IS INOPERABLE AND UNABLE TO BE REPAIRED. IN ADDITION, SITE UPGRADES NEED TO BE MADE TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH DEQ ENVIRONMENTAL PERMITTING REGULATIONS REGARDING DISPOSAL OF WASTE AND WATER QUALITY. THE END GOAL IS TO HAVE AN OPERATIONAL FISH CLEANING STATION THAT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS, PROVIDING THE PUBLIC AN ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE PLACE TO WASH AND DISPOSE OF FISH WASTE, THEREBY PROTECTING THE PARKS RESOURCES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RECIPIENT WILL REPLACE THE EXISTING FISH CLEANING STATION AND BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH DEQ ENVIRONMENTAL PERMITTING REGULATION REGARDING DISPOSAL OF WASTE AND WATER QUALITY.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: TO PROVIDE AN OPERATIONAL FISH CLEANING STATION THAT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS AND SAFE PLACE TO WASH AND DISPOSE OF FISH WASTE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT PROVIDES A BENEFIT TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY BY ASSISTING THE MANAGING PARTNER WITH A MAJOR REPAIR REPLACEMENT OF A FACILITY AND MAKING SITE UPDATES TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITYS (DEQ) GUIDELINES. HAVING A DEDICATED SITE FOR FISH CLEANING HELPS PROTECT THE NATURAL AND WATER RESOURCES FROM CONTAMINATION BY UNMANAGED OR IMPROPERLY DISPOSED FISH WASTE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

PER MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT 3-LM-40-01000 (MOA), THIS PROJECT IS A COST SHARE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE STATE OF COLORADO (COLORADO PARKS AND WILDLIFE) AND RECLAMATION FOR MANAGEMENT, OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH EACH OF THE SEVEN RESERVOIR AREAS STATE PARKS. IN ACCORDANCE WITH 16 U.S.C. 4601-13 ET SEQ, RECLAMATION DOES NOT HAVE THE DISCRETION TO AWARD A FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT FOR COST-SHARING TO ANY OTHER ENTITY EXCEPT THE MANAGING PARTNER. THEREFORE, COLORADO PARKS AND WILDLIFE WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE MANAGEMENT, OPERATIONS, MAINTENANCE, AND REPLACEMENT OF RECREATION, RECREATION FACILITIES, AND OTHER RELATED RESPONSIBILITIES AT SEVEN RECLAMATION RESERVOIRS AND STATE PARKS LOCATED IN WESTERN COLORADONAVAJO, CRAWFORD, PAONIA, MANCOS, RIDGWAY, RIFLE GAP, AND VEGA STATE PARK:STAFF THE HEADQUARTERS AND VISITOR CENTER FOR ACTIVITIES AT THE PARK. OPEN VARIOUS PARK FACILITIES FOR THE UPCOMING SEASON.  THESE FACILITIES ARE OPENED IN THE SPRING, WATER WILL BE TURNED ON, FACILITIES CLEANED, LEAKS FIXED, ETC. TO GET READY FOR THE SUMMER, THEN WHEN SUMMER ENDS FACILITIES ARE WINTERIZED TO PREPARE FOR WINTER.OPEN THE BOAT RAMP AND COMPLETE ANS INSPECTIONS AS BOATS ENTER THE PARK.GENERAL MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR PROJECTS INCLUDING CAMPSITES, DAY USE, PAINTING, STAINING, REPAIR FENCING, TRAIL REPAIR AND IMPROVEMENTS, ORDERED AND REPLACED SIGNS, ETC.ADMINISTRATION, MANAGEMENT, AND OPERATIONS OF PARK STAFF, PARK FACILITIES, RECREATION ACTIVITIES, PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY, PARK RESOURCES, SPECIAL EVENTS, ETC. DAILY WEEKLY CUSTODIAL SERVICES ON FACILITIES SUCH AS RESTROOMS, VAULT TOILETS, CABINS, VISITOR CENTER, AND PARK OFFICES.WASTE DISPOSAL FROM VAULT RESTROOMS AND TRASH REMOVAL THROUGHOUT PARK.VEHICLE AND EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE, ETC.PURCHASE MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES FOR PARK MAINTENANCE, GROUNDS MAINTENANCE, OFFICE AND CLEANING SUPPLIES, RESTROOM SUPPLIES.OTHER DUTIES PERTAINING TO OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE, AS NEEDED.CONDUCT SAFETY PATROL OPERATIONS IN THE PARK AREA.THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT THROUGH THE CONTINUED USE OF THE RECREATION AREAS STATE PARKS, AND THE ASSOCIATED RECREATION FACILITIES, AND THE CONTINUED ENJOYMENT OF A WIDE ARRAY OF WATER AND LAND-BASED RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AT THESE POPULAR RESERVOIR AREAS.

AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO REPLACE AND UPGRADE HOWARD PRAIRIE RESORT MARINA TO MEET ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS AND PROVIDE 154 BOAT SLIPS FOR BOATING PURPOSES TO THE RECREATING PUBLIC. THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALSO REPAVE THE RESORT FACILITY TO PROVIDE SAFE DRIVING AND WALKING SURFACES TO THE PUBLIC FOR CAMPING, DAY-USE, BOATING, AND FISHING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL COMPLETE THE NEXT PHASE IN THE REDESIGN OF THE HOWARD PRAIRIE RESORTS ACCESSIBLE MARINA AND WILL ALSO REPAVE THE REPOST.  THIS PROJECT WILL ADD ACCESSIBLE FINGER FLOATS THAT CONNECT THE MAIN DOCK CREATING 165 BOAT SLIPS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO RE-PAVE THE ENTIRE RESORT PROPERTY INCLUDING TWO CAMPGROUND LOOPS, DAY USE PARKING, BOAT TRAILER PARKING AND THE ACCESSIBLE FISHING PIER TRAIL.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT IS INCREASED ACCESS TO THE RESERVOIR BY ALLOWING BOAT ACCESS DURING DRY YEARS AND INCREASED AND IMPROVED ACCESS FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH THE ACCESSIBILITY IMPROVEMENTS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RECREATING PUBLIC, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): NONE KNOWN

AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AT HAYSTACK RESERVOIR.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR THE PUBLIC TO CONTINUE TO SAFELY RECREATE AT THE RESERVOIR.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT WILL OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THE OUTDOOR RECREATION FACILITIES AT HAYSTACK RESERVOIR ON THE DESCHUTES PROJECT. ANNUAL OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE INCLUDE: STAFF SALARIES AND BENEFITS, SUPPLIES AND MATERIALS, CONSTRUCTION IMPROVEMENTS TO FACILITIES, CONTRACTUAL SERVICES, AND EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE AND RENTALS. ALL WORK WILL BE COMPLETED AT THE RECLAMATION FACILITIES TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE A CLEAN AND SAFE AREA TO RECREATE AT. THIS ADDITIONAL FUNDING WILL PROVIDE CCPRD TO INCREASE THEIR TIME AT HAYSTACK FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS, EDUCATE AND ENFORCE PARK REGULATIONS, AND TO HAVE MORE OF A PRESENCE TO SUPPORT THE VOLUNTEER CAMPGROUND HOSTS. INCREASING SITE VISITS TO COMPLETE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE MEETS FEDERAL HEALTH AND SAFETY STANDARDS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE CONTINUED ABILITY OF THE PUBLIC TO RECREATE AT THE RECREATION FACILITIES THAT ARE CURRENTLY AVAILABLE AT HAYSTACK RESERVOIR.  WITHOUT THIS PROJECT, THE FACILITIES COULD BE UNABLE TO BE MAINTAINED DUE TO A LACK OF FUNDING.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO UTILIZE THE RESERVOIR FOR RECREATING.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): NONE

AWARD PURPOSE: FUNDING THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT WILL INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC USE OF THE RECREATION AREAS AT LAKE CASITAS RECREATION AREA.  FUNDS WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR PROPER OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND REPLACEMENT OF FACILITIES IN PLACE FOR PUBLIC RECREATION USE AT LAKE CASITAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:RV AND TRAILER SITES WILL BE IMPROVED, WITH THE ADDITION OF DECOMPOSED GRANITE (DG) IN PLACE OF GRASS, ENLARGING CAMPSITES TO ACCOMMODATE GUEST AS WELL AS PROVIDING ADA ACCESSIBILITY WITH THE ADDITIONAL AREA.  THE OBJECTIVE IS TO REPAIR, REMOVE, OR RESURFACE THE MAIN ROAD AND THOSE IN AND OUT OF CAMPGROUNDS. THE MAIN ROAD IS IN DIRE NEED OF REPAIR AS WELL AS CAMPGROUNDS ROADS. THERE ARE VARIOUS METHODS OF RESURFACING THAT ARE USED WITHIN THE PARK.  PULVERIZE IN PLACE OF EXISTING ASPHALT, CAPE SEAL AN AREA TO BE RE-CONDITIONED THAT DOES NOT REQUIRE ADDITIONAL DEPTH OF ASPHALT, AND STRAIGHT RE-SURFACE FOR AREAS THAT ARE DAMAGED AND NEED COMPLETE SEAL.PLAYGROUNDS WITHIN THE PARK NEED RESURFACE MATERIAL FREQUENTLY. THE LCRA HAS GONE AWAY WITH THE PELLETS AS AN EFFECTIVE SURFACE, AND RECENTLY COMPLETED A POUR IN PLACE RUBBER TO ALL PLAYGROUNDS. PLAYBOUND POURED-IN-PLACE IS A 2-LAYER SYSTEM CONSISTING OF A BASEMAT OF 100  POST-CONSUMER RECYCLED SBR (STYRENE BUTADIENE RUBBER) AND POLYURETHANE AND A TOP SURFACE CONSISTING OF RECYCLED POST-INDUSTRIAL RUBBER, WHICH SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASING THE SURFACES EXPECTED LIFE TO 7 TO 10 YEARS. THICKNESS CAN BE MODIFIED ON SITE TO MEET VARYING CRITICAL FALL HEIGHTS AND IS ADA COMPLIANT FOR PLAYGROUND SURFACE ACCESSIBILITY. PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: PUBLIC USE FACILITIES RECEIVE HEAVY VISITOR TRAFFIC DURING THE PEAK SUMMER MONTHS, THAT ACTION WEARS ON THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE PARK IN ROAD DAMAGE, EQUIPMENT WEAR AND TEAR, AND PLAYGROUND UPKEEP THAT REQUIRES YEARLY MAINTENANCE. THESE OBJECTIVES NEED TO BE MET FOR THE RECREATION AREA TO ADEQUATELY MEET ITS PLANNED IMPROVED OPERATION FOR PUBLIC USE OF THE AREA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO BENEFIT THE PUBLIC BY FUNDING ACTIVITIES CONSIDERED HIGHLY IMPORTANT TO THE INTEGRITY OF THE RECREATION AREA AND WHAT IT HAS TO OFFER TO THE VISITING PUBLIC. AS THE FUNDS ARE IDENTIFIED THEY WILL BE APPLIED TO BUDGET ESTIMATES.  SAFETY IS A PRIMARY CONCERN THROUGHOUT THE PARK AND THE CONDITION OF THE INFRASTRUCTURE IS VITAL IN ASSURING THE VISITOR HAS A SAFE AND WELL-MAINTAINED AREA TO TRAVEL IN, EITHER BY VEHICLE, BICYCLE OR ON FOOT. ROAD IMPROVEMENTS, RESURFACING OR REPLACEMENT WILL TAKE PLACE EACH YEAR, PRIOR TO HEAVY PUBLIC USE OF THE AREA WHICH USUALLY STARTS IN APRIL OF ANY YEAR. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

RECLAMATION AND THE SHERIDAN COUNTY PARK BOARD (RECIPIENT) HAVE A MANAGING PARTNER AGREEMENT 2-AG-60-01650, DATED JUNE 11, 1992. THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION AND THE RECIPIENT WILL ENHANCE THE RECREATION EXPERIENCE OF VISITOR TO THE HOFFER LAKE RECREATION AREA BY MAINTAINING SERVICEABILITY AND CONTINUED USER SATISFACTION, ASSURING PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY BY PROVIDING UTILITIES AND IMPROVEMENTS. THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL ALLOW FOR THE DRAINAGE OF WATER AWAY FROM THE 4H BUILDING TO STRAIGHTEN THE BUILDING STRUCTURE: DRAIN TILE AROUND 4H BUILDING AND SEPTIC TANKS, LANDSCAPING, INSTALLING CONCRETE CURBS, AND INSTALLING TWO CULVERTS.

THE RED HILLS WATER SYSTEM PROVIDES POTABLE WATER TO THE SEMINOE STATE PARK HEADQUARTERS VISITOR CENTER, AND CAMPGROUNDS. DUE TO THE AGING WATER SYSTEM, EMERGENCY REPAIRS MUST BE DONE. DUE TO THIS, THE WATER SYSTEM MUST BE REPLACED TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE POTABLE WATER TO STAFF AND TO THE PUBLIC.

THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING: VEGA STATE PARK: PERFORM MAINTENANCE (SEALCOAT, CRACK SEAL, PAINT STRIPING, AND REPAIR, ETC.) OF APPROXIMATELY 475,000 SQUARE FOOT OF EXISTING ASPHALT ROADWAYS AND PARKING LOTS ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE LAKE AND AT ASPEN GROVE CAMPGROUND.  RIDGWAY STATE PARK: UPGRADE ELECTRIC SERVICE AT 44 SITES ON TO G-LOOP.  ELECTRICAL RENOVATION UNDERGROUND AND ABOVE GROUND TO ADDRESS ANTIQUATED AND INADEQUATE ELECTRICAL SERVICE.  IT WILL REPLACE THE WIRING FROM THE MAIN SERVICE TO EACH SITE AND PUT EACH SITE ON FUSES CAPABLE OF ALLOWING FULL 50-AMP DRAW.  THIS WILL REQUIRE TRENCHING BORING FOR UNDERGROUND UTILITIES AND COMPLETE REPLACEMENT OF ABOVE GROUND PEDESTALS AND WIRING.   REMOVAL AND DISPOSAL OF ALL ITEMS NECESSARY FOR PROJECT COMPLETION WILL BE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONTRACTOR.  ALL DISTURBANCE WILL NEED TO BE RE-SEEDED POST PROJECT WITH AN APPROVED SEED MIX.  STATE PARKS AND RECLAMATION SHALL PARTNER TO UPGRADE FACILITIES AND DEVELOP RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.  THIS SHALL ENHANCE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE AT THE PARKS AND PROVIDE ECONOMIC BENEFIT TO THE COMMUNITY.

IDPR LAKE CASCADE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE FY 23-27 PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE: LAKE CASCADE IS THE FIFTH LARGEST BODY OF WATER IN THE STATE OF IDAHO AT 26,307 SURFACE ACRES AND 86 MILES OF SHORELINE. IT IS LOCATED 80 MILES NORTH OF BOISE IN IDAHOS WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, WITHIN VALLEY COUNTY. THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 300 CAMPSITES IN 10 DEVELOPED CAMPGROUNDS WITH POWER AND WATER, TWO DISPERSED CAMPING AREAS WITH PRIMITIVE CAMPING, SEVERAL DAY USE AREAS, AND 6 BOAT LAUNCH RAMPS. LAKE CASCADE STATE PARK OFFERS TWO GROUP OPPORTUNITIES, INCLUDING SNOWBANK GROUP CAMP AND OSPREY POINT GROUP YURTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: WILL CONTINUE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF CASCADE LAKE STATE PARK.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES WILL PROVIDE AN ACCESSIBLE RECREATION FACILITY. THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT UPON DATE OF AWARD, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2027.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE EXISTING FACILITIES WILL ENSURE THE PROTECTION OF PARK RESOURCES FOR PUBLIC USE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

THIS PROJECT SERVES TO PROVIDE FISH HABITAT WHILE ADDRESSING SOME OF THE CAUSES OF THE HABITAT LOSS. THE HABITAT SHOALS SHALL BE PLACED AT SEVERAL ELEVATIONS TO PROVIDE HABITAT THROUGH VARIOUS STAGES OF THE RESERVOIR DRAWDOWN. THE FIRST ROW SHALL BE PLACED AT THE LOWEST ELEVATION POSSIBLE WHILE THE SECOND ROW SHALL BE PLACED IN AN OFFSET PATTERN. THEY SHALL BE PLACED PARALLEL TO THE SHORELINE IN ROWS TO HELP STABILIZE THIS AREA MAKING IT LESS SUSCEPTIBLE TO EROSION. THE SHOALS SHALL BE CONSTRUCTED OUT OF RESERVOIR BASIN MATERIAL WHICH HELPS CREATE DEEPER POCKETS OF WATER AROUND THE STRUCTURES ADDING DIVERSITY AROUND THE SHOAL. ONCE CONSTRUCTED, THE SHOALS SHALL THEN BE COVERED WITH RIP RAP AND GRAVEL TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL FISH HABITAT FOR MULTIPLE LIFE STAGES. LOCATIONS FOR THE SHOALS AT MEDICINE CREEK AND SWANSON RESERVOIR SHALL BE DEVELOPED BASED ON INPUT FROM NEBRASKA GAME AND PARKS FISHERIES BIOLOGISTS AND BUREAU OF RECLAMATION PERSONNEL. ADDITIONALLY, 3 ROCK JETTIES PREVIOUSLY BUILT AT MEDICINE CREEK RESERVOIR SHALL BE RESTORED WITH THE ADDITION OF 2 FEET OF RIP RAP AND GRAVEL TO RESTORE ANGLER ACCESS TO THE RESERVOIR AT FULL POOL.

1  AWARD PURPOSE  IN JANUARY 2012, RECLAMATION AND THE STATE PARKS ENTERED INTO A MANAGING PARTNER AGREEMENT WHICH COMMITS RECLAMATION TO PROVIDING FUNDING UP TO  2,500,000  TO OFFSET THE COST OF OPERATING AND MAINTAINING THE FOLSOM AUBURN AND FOLSOM LAKE PROJECT AREAS  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE MANAGING PARTNER AGREEMENT STATE PARKS COMMITTED ALL REVENUES GENERATED FROM OPERATING THESE PARK FACILITIES, DAY USE, ANNUAL PERMIT FUNDS, AND STATE GRANT REVENUES RECEIVED FOR THE AUBURN AND FOLSOM STATE RECREATION AREAS  THE BALANCE OF THE FUNDING DEFICIT WOULD BE BORNE BY STATE PARKS UTILIZING THEIR OWN GENERAL FUND MONIES 2  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR IS AUTHORIZED TO CONSTRUCT, OPERATE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC OUTDOOR RECREATION AND FISH AND WILDLIFE ENHANCEMENT FACILITIES AND TO PROVIDE FOR PUBLIC USE AND ENJOYMENT OF UNIT LANDS IN A MANNER COORDINATED WITH OTHER UNIT PURPOSES  SUCH PURPOSES INCLUDE POWER GENERATION AND PROVISION OF WATER FOR AGRICULTURAL, MUNICIPAL AND INDUSTRIAL USE 3  EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME  SINCE FISCAL YEAR 2012 RECLAMATION HAS AWARDED AN AVERAGE OF  2,500,000 OF ALLOCATED FUNDS TO STATE PARKS FOR THE PROVISION OF LAW ENFORCEMENT, EMERGENCY RESPONSE, OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF RECREATION FACILITIES, AND VISITOR SERVICES ACTIVITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE MANAGING PARTNER AGREEMENT  STATE PARKS PROVIDES RECLAMATION WITH BI ANNUAL REPORTS OUTLINING THE LAW ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, OPERATIONS AND  MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES, FACILITY MAINTENANCE AND LONG TERM PLANNING WORK PERFORMED  STATE PARKS ALSO PROVIDES RECLAMATION WITH A FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING OF THE FUNDS RECEIVED, REVENUE GENERATED AND EXPENDITURES MADE USING BOTH STATE AND FEDERAL FUNDS 4  INTENDED BENEFICIARY  IES   ON JANUARY 24, 2012, RECLAMATION AND STATE PARKS EXECUTED A LONG TERM  25 YEAR  MANAGING PARTNER AGREEMENT  MPA  TO PERFORM LAW ENFORCEMENT, VISITOR MANAGEMENT, AND RECREATION ACTIVITIES ON FEDERAL LANDS AND WATERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE AUBURN PROJECT LANDS, FOLSOM RESERVOIR, AND LAKE NATOMA  PER THE TERMS OF THE MPA, THIS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL ENABLE RECLAMATION AND STATE PARKS TO PLAN FOR CURRENT  FACILITY MAINTENANCE, LAW ENFORCEMENT, NATURAL RESOURCE INTERPRETATION  AND FUTURE USES  FACILITY UPGRADES, DEFERRED MAINTENANCE, RECREATION SITE IMPROVEMENTS  AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE LANDS MANAGED BY STATE PARKS FOR RECLAMATION, SO AS TO PROVIDE FOR SAFE AND MANAGEABLE RECREATION USE OF THE PROJECT AREAS BY THE PUBLIC 5  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS GRANT

PROJECT ABSTRACT TEMPLATEAWARD PURPOSE  TO FULFILL THE COST SHARE FUNDING BETWEEN RECLAMATION AND THE RECIPIENT WHO WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE MANAGING PARTNER FOR THE RECREATIONAL GROUNDS AT THE WILLOW BAY RECREATION AREA  RECLAMATION OWNED   THIS WILL INCLUDE THE RECIPIENT TO FOLLOW THE ADMINISTRATION AND MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES GUIDELINES LISTED IN THE AMERICAN FALLS RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN TO IMPROVE THE FACILITY FOR PUBLIC USE  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  PROJECT ACTIVITIES FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FOR THIS AGREEMENT WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO MAINTENANCE AND OR IMPROVING THE BOAT DOCKS, TRASH COLLECTION, LANDSCAPE MOWING AND TRIMMING, WEED AND PEST CONTROL, CHANNEL DREDGING, SHORELINE CLEAN UP, CLEANING SUPPLIES, MINOR FACILITY REPAIR, REPAIR REPLACEMENT OF PICNIC TABLES FIRE GRILLS, ROAD, TRAIL AND PARKING LOT MAINTENANCE  SWEEPING, PAINTING, SNOW REMOVAL, ETC  , SPRINKLER REPAIRS, TOOL AND SMALL EQUIPMENT REPAIR AND REPLACEMENT, AND MISCELLANEOUS SERVICES NEEDED ACCORDING TO THE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT TERMS AND CONDITIONS  PROVIDE SAFE, UNIVERSAL ACCESS, AND ATTRACTIVE FACILITIES IN ORDER TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AND EXPERIENCEINSTALL AN INFORMATIONAL SIGN NEAR THE FLOATING TREATMENT WETLAND  FTW  TO SHOWCASE THE PROJECT, INCLUDING INFORMATION ABOUT THE PLANTS USED IN THE INSTALLATION AND THE BENEFITS OF FTW TO WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT  THE SIGN SHOULD NOTE IF THERE ARE ANY CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT PLANTS USED EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  IMPROVING THE BOAT DOCKS, PARK TRAILS, PARKING LOTS, AND INSTALL INFORMATION SIGNS ON THE FLOATING TREATMENT WETLAND ARE A FEW ITEMS THAT WILL HELP THE RECREATION PARK INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THE CITY OF AMERICAN FALLS TO BE ABLE TO IMPROVE THE FACILITY FOR PUBLIC USE SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   NA

AWARD PURPOSE  DUE TO THE HIGH OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE COSTS OF THE PARK FACILITIES AND THE LIMITED FINANCIAL RESOURCES, THE TOWN HAS BEEN UNABLE TO ADDRESS THE NUMEROUS HEALTH AND SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS OUTLINED IN THE MANAGING AGREEMENT AND ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS HAVE NOT BEEN MET  THE TOWN HAS IDENTIFIED IMPORTANT MAINTENANCE NEEDS WHICH IS THE BASIS OF REQUESTING 50  REIMBURSEMENT FOR OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE COSTS INCURRED OVER THE NEXT FIVE YEARS ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  WILL CONTINUE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF COULEE CITY CAMPGROUND EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES WILL PROVIDE AN ACCESSIBLE RECREATION FACILITY  THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT UPON DATE OF AWARD, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2026 INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PARTNERSHIP AND THE PROGRAM IS TO COOPERATIVELY PROVIDE SAFE, ACCESSIBLE RECREATION FACILITY WHICH MAY BE ENJOYED BY THE AMERICAN PUBLIC SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

AWARD PURPOSE  FUNDING FRORN THIS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE LABOR COSTS FOR THE PARK SOPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE, COVER THE COSTS OF SUPPLIES, TOOLS, AND EQUIPMENT AS WELL AS COVER ROUTINEMAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS ASSOCIATED WITH THE OPERATION OF THE BOAT RAMP RECREATION AREA ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE ROUTINE MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS THAT WILL BE COVERED BY THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE MAINTAINING THE GRAVEL PARKING AREA, MOWING THE WEEDS SURROUNDING THE PARKING AREA AND BOAT RAMP, MAINTAINING PICNIC AREAS, CLEANING VAULT TOILETS, MAINTAINING AND INSTALLING THE BOAT DOCK, REPAIRING THE SHELTERS, WEEKLY TRASH REMOVAL, AND TRAFFIC CONTROL EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  IN THE PAST POWER COUNTY HAS MANAGED THE RECREATION AREA WITHOUT ADDITIONAL FEDERAL FUNDING, HOWEVER, INCREASING PUBLIC USE OF THE RECREATION AREA HAS NECESSITATED FEDERAL FUNDING FOR RECLAMATION TO FULFILL ITS OBLIGATION TO PROVIDE SAFE RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH THE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT THE PUBLIC UTILIZES THE WEST BOAT RAMP AND ASSOCIATED RECREATION AREA THROUGHOUT THE YEAR  THIS FUNDING WILL CREATED A SAFER ENVIRONMENT FOR THE RECREATING PUBLIC AS WELL AS PROVIDE A CLEANER ENVIRONMENT FOR THOSE WHO UTILIZE THE RECREATION AREA INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THIS WILL ENABLE THE RECREATION AREA TO CONTINUE TO BE OPEN THROUGHOUT THE YEAR WHICH WILL ALLOW THE PUBLIC TO CONTINUE TO HAVE OPPORTUNITIES TO RECREATE AT THE AMERICAN FALLS RESERVOIR SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD

2022 2026 NORTH DAM PARK OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE  THE NORTH DAM PARK  PARK  IS LOCATED WITHIN THE TOWN LIMITS OF GRAND COULEE, WASHINGTON, AND SITS DIRECTLY BELOW THE NORTH DAM  THE 7  ACRES OF LAND THE PARK RESTS UPON IS OWNED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT AND AUTHORITY RESTS WITH THE RECLAMATION THE PARK CONSISTS OF TWO BASEBALL FIELDS, A TENNIS COURT, A SKATE PARK, CHILDREN S PLAY AREA, A CONCESSION BUILDING WITH RESTROOMS, A GAZEBO WITH AMPHITHEATER SITTING, A PICNIC SHELTER, WINDMILL EXHIBIT, PATHWAYS TO EXISTING FEATURES, AND VAST GRASS AND OTHER VEGETATION IN ADDITION TO VIEWS OF BANKS LAKE AND THE NORTH DAM  USE OF THIS PARK SERVES THE LOCAL COMMUNITY FOR GENERAL RECREATION ANNUALLY, AND COMMUNITY AND CORPORATE EVENTS IN DURING THE SPRING AND SUMMER MONTHS ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO FEE COLLECTION  PUBLIC SERVICE FUNCTIONS, SUCH AS COMPLIANCE ENFORCEMENT, INTERPRETATION, SPECIAL EVENT PROGRAMS AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH  TRASH COLLECTION  SANITATION SERVICES  ROAD, MINOR MAINTENANCE OF BUILDINGS, GROUNDS, AND EQUIPMENT, FACILITY AND TRAIL CLEANING  PEST AND WEED CONTROL EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE RECIPIENT TO CONTINUE PROVIDING A SAFE, CLEAN, CARED FOR RECREATIONAL AREA FOR THE PUBLIC  THE WORK FOR THIS PROJECT WILL OCCUR ONCE THE FUNDS ARE AUTHORIZED WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2026 INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE EXISTING FACILITIES WILL ENSURE THE PROTECTION OF PARK RESOURCES FOR PUBLIC USE  THE NORTH DAM PARK IS USED FOR A VARIETY OF AGES AND MULTIPLE EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

1. AWARD PURPOSE: THE OVERALL PROJECT IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE A SIGNIFICANT BENEFIT TO BOATERS AND RECREATION PARK USERS.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED FOR AGREEMENT WILL BE THE REMOVAL OF ALL LAYERS OF THE EXISTING ROOF AND PULL OUT OR NAIL DOWN ALL NAILS SO THAT THE NEW MATERIALS CAN BE INSTALLED PROPERLY. ALL OLD MATERIALS WILL BE DISPOSED OF AT A PROPER DUMPING FACILITY, INSTALL TWO LAYERS OF ROOF DECK PROTECTION, NEW SHINGLES, AND RIDGE VENTILATION SYSTEM, ALONG WITH FLASHING PER MANUFACTURE'S SPECIFICATION, CLEAN OUT GUTTER SYSTEM OF DEBRIS AND BROOM CLEAN EXTERIOR OF THE JOB SITE OF ALL DEBRIS GENERATED BY THIS WORK.3. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THIS AGREEMENT IS TO REMOVE AND REPLACE THE EXISTING ROOF ON CONTRA LOMA SERVICE YARD BUILDING.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO REPLACEMENT AND UPGRADE EXITING ROOF IN THE CONTRA LOMA YARD BUILDING.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

SPORTSMAN S PARK OAND M PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE  SPORTSMAN S PARK IS LOCATED THREE MILES EAST OF ABERDEEN, IDAHO IN BINGHAM COUNTY  THE PARK IS A MULTI USE AREA WITH FACILITIES AND ACTIVITIES FOR A VARIETY OF RECREATIONAL USES WHICH INCLUDE TWO LARGE GROUP SHELTERS AND EIGHT SMALLER PICNIC SHELTERS, TWO PLAYGROUNDS, THREE RESTROOMS, HORSESHOE PITS AND VOLLEYBALL COURTS, 23 SITES WITH ELECTRIC AND WATER, 5 SITES WITH ELECTRIC ONLY AND 8 TENT SITES, AND A RV DUMP STATION IS AVAILABLE  THERE IS A PAVED HIKING BICYCLE TRAIL ALONG THE RIM OF THE RESERVOIR  THE TRAILHEAD IS AT THE PARK AND IS 1 1 MILES LONG  SPECIAL FEATURES ARE TWO OBSERVATION PLATFORMS WITH A PAVILION AND BENCHES FOR USERS TO OBSERVE THE WATERFOWL  SITUATED ADJACENT TO THE AMERICAN FALLS RESERVOIR, IT PROVIDES PRIMARY ACCESS TO THE LAKE FOR BOATERS AND FISHERMEN WITH TWO BOAT RAMPS  THE PARK IS ALSO A POPULAR SPOT FOR ICE FISHERMEN IN THE WINTER ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  INCLUDE DAY TO DAY CAMPGROUND DUTIES, INCLUDING CLEANING OF BATHROOMS, TAKING RESERVATIONS, CHECKING IN GUESTS, COLLECTING AND VERIFYING PAYMENT, EDUCATING VISITORS ON PARK RULES, MAINTAINING SECURITY, MOWING, PEST CONTROL, AND GENERAL UPKEEP EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE RECIPIENT TO CONTINUE PROVIDING A SAFE, CLEAN, CARED FOR RECREATIONAL AREA FOR THE PUBLIC  THE WORK FOR THIS PROJECT WILL OCCUR ONCE THE FUNDS ARE AUTHORIZED WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2027 INTENDED BENEFICIARIES CONTINUED OAND M OF SPORTSMAN S PARK IS IMPERATIVE FOR PUBLIC ACCESS AND HEALTH AND SAFETY AT THE AMERICAN FALLS RESERVOIR, A FEDERAL WATER PROJECT  THE BENEFITS OF OUTDOOR RECREATION TO MENTAL AND PHYSICAL WELLBEING FOR THE INDIVIDUAL AND SOCIETY ARE WITHOUT END  THE OUTDOORS PROVIDES EDUCATIONAL VENUE AND CREATIVE INSPIRATION  PROVIDING SAFE ACCESS TO RECREATION CONTRIBUTES TO FULFILLMENT OF RECLAMATION S OBLIGATION AND MISSION SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

THE AGREEMENT WITH KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE, PARKS AND TOURISM FOR RECREATION SITE IMPROVEMENTS AT WEBSTER RESERVOIR TRANSFERS FEDERAL FUNDS FOR THE INSTALLATION OF A DUMP STATION TO BE UTILIZED BY RECREATORS AT LAKEVIEW AND ROCK POINT CAMPGROUNDS  INSTALLATION OF THE DUMP STATION WILL PROVIDE CLEAN, ACCESSIBLE RECREATION FACILITIES TO ALL GUESTS, HELP ASSURE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY, AND PROTECT RESOURCES

PINAL COUNTY OPEN SPACE AND TRAILS ENTERED INTO A RECREATIONAL LAND USE AGREEMENT  RLUA  WITH RECLAMATION IN 2016 TO DEVELOP, OPERATE, AND MAINTAIN THE PORTION OF THE CENTRAL ARIZONA PROJECT  CAP  TRAIL WITHIN PINAL COUNTY  THE RLUA BREAKS THE PORTION OF THE CAP TRAIL WITHIN PINAL COUNTY INTO ELEVEN SEGMENTS, WHICH WILL FOLLOW PINAL COUNTY S 2015 CAP TRAIL MASTER PLAN TO CONSTRUCT AND OR OPERATE THE CAP TRAIL UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL OPEN UP FOR PUBLIC ACCESS FOUR SEGMENTS OF THE CENTRAL ARIZONA PROJECT  CAP  TRAIL  THE SEGMENTS ARE SOUTH PICACHO, NORTH PICACHO, COOLIDGE, AND SOUTH FLORENCE  OPENING UP OF EACH SEGMENT FOR PUBLIC ACCESS WILL INVOLVE CONSTRUCTING 3 TRAILHEADS, AND INSTALLING FENCING, ACCESS GATES, AND SIGNAGE

THE MISSION OF RECLAMATION IS TO MANAGE, DEVELOP, AND PROTECT WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES IN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY AND ECONOMICALLY SOUND MANNER IN THE INTEREST OF THE AMERICAN PUBLIC  RECLAMATION HAS A MAJOR RESPONSIBILITY, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH WATER USERS, STATE, AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES, TO HELP IMPROVE WATER RESOURCES AND THE EFFICIENCY OF WATER USE IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES  AFTER MORE THAN 100 YEARS, RECLAMATION S PRIMARY ROLE HAS EVOLVED FROM ONE OF WATER RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT TO ONE OF WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT RECLAMATION PLAYS A MAJOR ROLE IN MEETING THE INCREASING DEMANDS FOR WATER BASED OUTDOOR RECREATION FACILITIES AND OPPORTUNITIES  RECREATION AREAS DEVELOPED AS A RESULT OF RECLAMATION WATER PROJECTS ARE AMONG THE NATION S MOST POPULAR FOR WATER BASED OUTDOOR RECREATION  RECLAMATION WORKS WITH FEDERAL AND NON FEDERAL PARTNERS TO PROVIDE QUALITY RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE 17 WESTERN STATES  THESE PARTNERS HAVE BEEN, AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE, THE PRIMARY PROVIDERS OF RECREATION AND CONCESSION MANAGED ACTIVITIES AT AUTHORIZED RECLAMATION PROJECTS THESE COST SHARE PROJECTS REFLECT RECLAMATION S SUPPORT OF THE MANAGING PARTNER, TRI CITIES JOINT JOB AUTHORITY  TCJJDA , FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF FEDERAL PROJECT LAND AND WATER AREAS AND THE CONSTRUCTION, OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND REPLACEMENT OF FACILITIES THAT WILL BEST PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION OF SUCH LANDS OR FACILITIES IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST  THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE A BETTER RECREATION EXPERIENCE, PROTECT RESOURCES, PRESERVE INFRASTRUCTURE, EXPAND UNIVERSALLY ACCESSIBLE OPPORTUNITIES, AND HELP TO ASSURE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY

THE MISSION OF RECLAMATION IS TO MANAGE, DEVELOP, AND PROTECT WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES IN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY AND ECONOMICALLY SOUND MANNER IN THE INTEREST OF THE AMERICAN PUBLIC  RECLAMATION HAS A MAJOR RESPONSIBILITY, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH WATER USERS, STATE, AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES, TO HELP IMPROVE WATER RESOURCES AND THE EFFICIENCY OF WATER USE IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES  AFTER MORE THAN 100 YEARS, RECLAMATION S PRIMARY ROLE HAS EVOLVED FROM ONE OF WATER RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT TO ONE OF WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT RECLAMATION PLAYS A MAJOR ROLE IN MEETING THE INCREASING DEMANDS FOR WATER BASED OUTDOOR RECREATION FACILITIES AND OPPORTUNITIES  RECREATION AREAS DEVELOPED AS A RESULT OF RECLAMATION WATER PROJECTS ARE AMONG THE NATION S MOST POPULAR FOR WATER BASED OUTDOOR RECREATION  RECLAMATION WORKS WITH FEDERAL AND NON FEDERAL PARTNERS TO PROVIDE QUALITY RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE 17 WESTERN STATES  THESE PARTNERS HAVE BEEN, AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE, THE PRIMARY PROVIDERS OF RECREATION AND CONCESSION MANAGED ACTIVITIES AT AUTHORIZED RECLAMATION PROJECTS THESE COST SHARE PROJECTS REFLECT RECLAMATION S SUPPORT OF THE STATE MANAGING PARTNER, SOUTH DAKOTA GAME, FISH, AND PARKS  GFP , FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF FEDERAL PROJECT LAND AND WATER AREAS AND THE CONSTRUCTION, OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND REPLACEMENT OF FACILITIES THAT WILL BEST PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION OF SUCH LANDS OR FACILITIES IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST  THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE A BETTER RECREATION EXPERIENCE, PROTECT RESOURCES, PRESERVE INFRASTRUCTURE, EXPAND UNIVERSALLY ACCESSIBLE OPPORTUNITIES, AND HELP TO ASSURE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY

IMPROVEMENTS OF AGING RECREATIONAL FACILITIES WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING DIVERSIFIED RECREATIONAL FACILITIES      AND USES TO ENHANCE VISITOR EXPERIENCES AT THE RESERVOIRMEET CHANGING DEMOGRAPHICS      AND TRENDS WHICH INCLUDE DESIRES FOR MODERN CAMPING EXPERIENCES PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY      RESTROOM, SHOWER, AND CAMPSITE CONDITIONSSAFETY FOR, AND      ACCESSIBILITY TO, ALL U S  CITIZENS BY MEETING CURRENT ADA REQUIREMENTSSTATE PARKS AND RECLAMATION SHALL PARTNER TO UPGRADE FACILITIES AND DEVELOP RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES  THIS SHALL ENHANCE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE AT THE RESERVOIR AND PROVIDE ECONOMIC BENEFIT TO THE COMMUNITY  IMPLEMENTATION OF THE REHABILITATION PROJECT COVERS DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF MULTIPLE AREAS OF DEER CREEK STATE PARK

THE ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK OF THE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE A BETTER RECREATION EXPERIENCE, PROTECT RESOURCES, PRESERVE INFRASTRUCTURE, EXPAND UNIVERSALLY ACCESSIBLE OPPORTUNITIES, AND HELP TO ASSURE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY  THE DEMAND FOR ELECTRICAL CAMPSITES AT BOX BUTTE HAS EXPANDED IN THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS  THE SHOWER HOUSE AND DUMP STATION WILL ENHANCE THE CAMPING EXPERIENCE AT BOX BUTTE  THERE WILL BE 2 ADA CAMPSITES IN THE PROPOSED CAMPGROUND TO BRING THE AREA UP TO ACCEPTABLE ADA NUMBERS

NEBRASKA GAME AND PARKS COMMISSION  NGPC  IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ADMINISTERING LANDS AND FACILITIES AT BOX BUTTE RESERVOIR, CALAMUS RESERVOIR, DAVIS CREEK RESERVOIR, ENDERS RESERVOIR, HARRY STRUNK RESERVOIR, HIGH BUTLER RESERVOIR, MERRITT RESERVOIR, SHERMAN RESERVOIR, AND SWANSON RESERVOIR  THIS INCLUDES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING DEVELOPMENT, OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND REPLACEMENT OF RECREATION FACILITIES AND ADMINISTRATION OF RECREATION AREAS THE DEMAND FOR ELECTRICAL CAMPSITES AT MERRITT HAS EXPANDED IN THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS  THE ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED IN THIS AGREEMENT WILL ASSIST NGPC IN MEETING THE NEEDS OF RECREATORS IN THE AREA UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION WILL TRANSFER FUNDS TO NGPC TO COVER UP TO 50  OF THE COST OF THE CAMPGROUND EXPANSION  THIS CAMPGROUND EXPANSION PROJECT WILL CONNECT TWO EXISTING CAMPGROUNDS WITH 21 MORE ELECTRICAL SITES TO MEET THE EVER RISING DEMAND FOR CAMPING AT THIS POPULAR STATE RECREATION AREA  THE ADDITION OF A SHOWER HOUSE WILL ALSO HELP WITH THE LARGE CROWDS THAT MERRITT IS SEEING SINCE THE BOOM IN CAMPING AND OUTDOOR RECREATION DEMAND IN THE LAST FEW YEARS

PURPOSE:DEVELOP RECREATION FACILITIES AT LAKE BERRYESSA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SOLICITATION AND SELECTION OF CONCESSION CONTRACTOR, AND AWARD OF EXCLUSIVE NEGOTIATED CONTRACT(S)COMPLETION OF CEQA AND NEPA REVIEW PROCESSAWARD OF GROUND LEASE AND CONCESSION DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATING AGREEMENT(S)DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONSTRUCTION OF RECREATION FACILITIES WILL CREATE SHORT-TERM EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, WHILE OPERATION OF THE FACILITIES WILL CREATE LONG-TERM EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL PROVIDE IMMEDIATE ECONOMIC ENHANCEMENT TO THE LAKE BERRYESSA AREA. THE PROJECT PROVIDES DESIGN AND ENGINEERING PLANS FOR THE RENOVATION AND RECONFIGURING AT THE RV PARK AT CACHUMA LAKE RECREATION AREA.  THE RV PARK CURRENTLY HOSTS 120 RV CAMPING SITES ON EIGHT ACRES ORIGINALLY BUILT AS A MOBILE HOME PARK IN THE LATE 1950'S.  IN THE LATE 1970'S THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT CHANGED THEIR POLICY AND WOULD NO LONGER ALLOW PERMANENT RESIDENTS TO RESIDE ON FEDERAL LAND AND THE MOBILE HOME PARK WAS CONVERTED TO AN RV PARK.  THE ORIGINAL INFRASTRUCTURE FROM 1950S REMAINS IN PLACE WITH CAST IRON SEWER LINES, GALVANIZED WATER LINES AND ALUMINUM DIRECT BURIAL ELECTRICAL SUPPLY.  

THE RENOVATION WILL REPLACE WATER, SEWER AND ELECTRICAL UTILITIES WITH NEW UTILITIES TO MEET CODE AND THE DEMANDS OF TODAY'S RV CAMPER, INCLUDING 50 AMP UPGRADES TO THE ELECTRICAL SUPPLY AT EACH RV SITE.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE REPLACEMENT OF CONCRETE PADS WITH RE-BAR INSTALLATION AS WELL AS NEW LANDSCAPING, PAVING, CAMPGROUND FURNISHINGS AND MINOR CAMP AREA ELEMENTS TO COMPLETE THE RENOVATION.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A SAFE AND ACCESSIBLE ACCESS TO QUALITY RECREATION FACILITIES FOR ALL VISITORS AT THE CONTRA LOMA REGIONAL PARK AND PROVIDE MAINTENANCE TO RECLAMATIONS LAND AND REAL PROPERTY IN SUPPORT OF EFFICIENT WATER AND POWER DELIVERY.
THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPLETE ADA PLAYGROUND IMPROVEMENTS AT MARY'S LAKE AND EAST PORTAL CAMPGROUNDS
